column1: POST : JAVA BE - Template Management - Move validation up to delegate layer and enhance exception tests to be more specific.
column11: Reach out to Tapas_WarRoom@sprint.com for access to this Jira Project
column29:
As a system, I want to move all possible validations to the framework entry point, so that I identify errors at the earliest possible moment.

Note: Validation should be accomplished at the earliest possible time, in our project that means in the delegate for input from the microservice consumer. We are currently doing this at the last possible time in the repository. Additionally our exception tests need to be updated to look for the correct error message to ensure we are catching the expected error. 

*Acceptance Criteria*
*  Tests are corrected
* Validation has been moved to Delegate Layer.

Acceptance:

 * Calls to "availablePaymentMethods" from the Payment Domain result in a call sent to the Payment Methods MS.

column1: PAYMENT: Payment Methods MS Connect to EPP Gateway Ms
column11: Reach out to Tapas_WarRoom@sprint.com for access to this Jira Project
column29:
As the Payment Methods MS, I want to be able to connect to the EPP Gateway MS to call the following operations:

 
 * Get Wallet Info.
 * Validate Payment Method.
 * Create Channel policy.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
 * The Payment Methods MS is able to perform the operations connecting successfully to the EPP Gateway MS.

Possible Tasks:
 * run the add external service command on msbuilder with the EPP Gateway MS yaml on the payment Methods MS.
 * Create the gateway layer and mappers for the operations required.
 * Create the service layer.
 * Modify the resource layer.
 * Unit Test and Wiremock

column1: POST : BULK - Modal - Drag/Drop Header Mapping UI
column11: Reach out to Tapas_WarRoom@sprint.com for access to this Jira Project
column29:
As a POST user, I want a way to remap the headers of my Excel file to that of the required data in the template I've selected, so that I'm not thanking "Galaxy S10" for his purchase of a "Fred".

*Acceptance Criteria*
 * System should ingest both the template's required metadata and that of the User's Bulk Data upload.
 * Headers from both sets of data should be displayed vertically side-by-side, and the user should be able to simply draw a line from one header to the other to mark them as corresponding.
 * Should be a very engaging, visual user experience.

column1: POST : BULK - Modal - Convert Input Bulk Data into Backend-Specified Format
column11: Reach out to Tapas_WarRoom@sprint.com for access to this Jira Project
column29:
As a POST front-end developer, I want to have my data from Bulk inputs standardized to a homogenous format that is compatible with the back-end's expectations, so that they'll actually send the bulk mail I've asked them to.

+*Acceptance Criteria*+
* Gather the information from the back-end and settle on a data exchange format that will allow the front end to hand a massive slab of data to the backend.
* Adjust the bulk mail system's data management system such that it conforms to the decided-upon format, and is capable of being ingested by the service.

It's worth noting the following:
 # A sufficiently LARGE file may be too much for us to be able to pass through an asynchronous call. Should this prove to be the case, we need to be able to upload/generate/ftp/etc. a file to a location for retrieval by the backend.
 # The format may be radically different from the current data

column1: POST : TEMPL - Versioning - Time Selection & Preview
column11: Reach out to Tapas_WarRoom@sprint.com for access to this Jira Project
column29:
As a POST admin user I want to be able to "look back through time" at the historical versions of the selected template to view/restore previous iterations so that I can cover any requirements as it pertains to regulatory restrictions, and so I can recover older versions of same when I inevitably botch something.

*Acceptance Criteria*

+User Journey+
 # [Windows Restore|[https://www.lifewire.com/how-to-use-system-restore-in-windows-2626131]] Model:
 # User currently has a template selected.
 # User clicks "Versioning"
 # !image-2019-05-20-11-16-12-797.png!
 # User is presented with a list of _dates_ (representing the days templates were added to the version archive)
 # Upon selecting a date, user is presented with a list of _times_ (representing the times within the selected date templates were added to the version archive)
 # User will be presented a preview of the selected date/time combination, and the options to enable the template selected (thereby adding the current version to the version history itself and replacing it wholesale), or to cancel and select a new date/time combination.

Primary tasks:
 # Upon clicking the versioning button, the user is presented with a list of all the previous *dates* and *times* upon which former versions of their selected template exist (that is to say, datetimes in which the template was in _any way altered_ from its original form
 ## What I'd LIKE to see is a calendar interface (user can scroll from month to month, year to year. Days in which a template had changed would be highlighted or in some other fashion indicated.
 ## Upon clicking on one of the so-indicated dates, the user will then be presented with a list of times.
 ## Clicking one of those will, in turn, direct the user to...

 # A preview GUI. This will render the code of the newly-selected datetime:
 ## Retrieve the versioned template form couchbase
 ## Load the historical rendition of the selected template/datetime combination into the shared previewer component - replete with its sample data - to allow the user to view their selection.
 ## User will be provided with Approve/Reject/Duplicate UI elements.
 ### Clicking the Reject button will direct the user back to the Select a Template Version screen
 ### Clicking the Approve button will _overwrite_ the existing selected template with that of the selected historical version. After the conclusion of the user flow user shall be redirected to the edit template screen from which the flow originated.
 ### Selecting the Duplicate UI element will _clone_ the selected historical into a _new_ template and save it to the template library. After the conclusion of the user flow, user shall be redirected to the edit template screen from which the flow originated.
column35: Ux designing for the time selection and preview ;06/Aug/19 9:57 AM;Pavankumar.Durgempudi@sprint.com;21600
column36: working on  the time selection for the versining;07/Aug/19 9:14 AM;Pavankumar.Durgempudi@sprint.com;21600

column1: KeyExchange: send ephemeral key message to kafka
column11: Reach out to Tapas_WarRoom@sprint.com for access to this Jira Project
column29:
As the KeyExchange Micro Service, I need to notify the Payment MS when Front-End System updates it's ephemeral key.  The front-end systems are going to call through the KeyExchange MS with their ephemeral key to EAI.  When EAI responds with success, and the ephemeral key being exchanged is for the BAN portion of payment requests, we need to send a message to the Kafka topic so Payment MS can decrypt the BAN portion of messages sent from this front-end system.

Topic Name: to be decided

Message format: to be decided, but it will need to identify the front-end system as well as contain the new key

*+Acceptance Criteria+*
 * Message sent to Kafka topic from KeyExchange. 
 * Payment Management MS should be able to read the message posted in Kafka. 

*+Possible Tasks:+* 
 * Identify how to maintain separate keys entered in kafka. 
 * Test cases
 * Test plan
 * Actual testing

column29:

 * Get Wallet Info
 *  Validate Payment methods
 * Create channel policy

 

*Acceptance Criteria:*

*Possible tasks*
 * Add transit sdk on API pom
 * Create gateway layer with mappers
 * Create steps for each operation on the service layer.

column1: POST : API (Adjust Polyfill for Interactivity) with Backend
column11: Reach out to Tapas_WarRoom@sprint.com for access to this Jira Project
column29:
As a front-end developer, I want a library that will allow my code to commune with the back-end, so that the two can find peace and harmony in a state of far-out and _very_ groovy love*.

*Acceptance Criteria*
 * Need a mechanism by which we can swap out the existing API library, such that real data is returned.


 * Ideally should be done in such a way so that the impact on our extant codebase is minimized.

 ** Call syntax should be as close to the current mechanism as possible (assuming "identical" proves not to be an option).


 ** Axios is currently in use; let's not introduce another library?


 * Decommission JSON server and DB.Schema.JSON.

 ** Consider possibility of killing DB.Schema.JSON with fire. At the very least, upon its decommissioning, executor of this task is advised to put its remains in a box, put that box in another box, mail it to themselves (pref: by way of Hong Kong), and then, upon its return arrival, smash it with a hammer. Bury the results deep in an unmarked hole in the desert at a depth of not less than 5 feet. 
... Wear gloves.


 * Sweep the site and verify that everything this breaks (and it _will_) is at least contained/confined to the thing that was broken.
 ** During said sweep, document any breaking code (unless the defect will literally be faster to fix than to document; this is about REDUCING technical debt, not layering more atop)


 ** Write stories (or at least the skeleton of same) for each piece of code so documented.

*Note*: This is ONE task that touches many pieces. The API code should not be broken out, but the corollary tasks (testing, documentation, story creation, etc. could be if absolutely necessary).

 

 
----
* Tralalala!
